H4069.def: = a reference to the cause, reason or purpose of an event; normally used in  questions with the purpose of identifying that cause, reason, or purpose; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that these things cannot be identified

H7706.def: = deity; ◄ of Israel; traditionally: Almighty One; better: All-sufficient One (= the One every good and perfect gift comes from); ≈ another name for Israel's God

H6845.def: = action by which humans hide themselves ► in order to attack another person

H6256.def: = a shorter or longer moment in the passage of time

H3045.def: = process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind

H2372.def: = process by which someone perceives an important object with the eyes, or witnesses an event of some significance

H3117.def: = the time of day that it is light, as opposed to the time that it is dark

H5381.def: = action by which humans succeed to catch up with other humans after having pursued them

H1367.def: = a set of limits that separates part of a whole from other parts, with focus either on the limits itself or on the area or object surrounded by it

H7462.def: = action by which animals are feeding on grass and other edible materials in the field, ≈ often extended to denote the way a king cares for his subjects or the way God cares for his people

H1497.def: = action by which humans take property unlawfully from a person or place, usually by force or threat of force

H5739.def: = a large group of domesticated mammals that moves and stays together, either in an enclosure or in a open area ◄ usually sheep or goats, but can also include camels or cattle

H5090.def: = causative action by which humans or deities cause (other) humans or animals to journey from one place to the other, whether with force or not

H2543.def: = domestic animal belonging to the same family as the horse, but smaller and with longer ears; it can have variety of colors from dark brown, through light brown to gray and occasionally white; ◄ |iEquus Asinus africanus;|i* ► used to ride on, carry loads, or do other work; ≈ highly regarded; for male see {L:עַיִר<SDBH:עַיִר>}; female see {L:אָתֹון<SDBH:אָתֹון>}

H3490.def: = person whose father has passed away and therefore unable to care for himself; ≈ regarded as one of the weaker members of the society and should therefore receive special care, together with the aliens, the widows, and other people who are poor

H490.def: = woman whose husband has died and therefore has difficulty caring for herself; ≈ regarded as one of the weaker members of the society and should therefore receive special care, together with the aliens, the fatherless, and other people who are poor

H5186.def: = state in which a relatively straight object is shaped into a curve

H34.def: = person who does not have the means to provide for himself/herself, economically or otherwise, and therefore depends on help from other people and God

H1870.def: = an open space connecting different places, ► used for travelling and transportation; ≈ often extended to denote our life as a journey from birth to death, and the totality of our activities during our lives

H6035.def: = state of persons who are suffering and unable to help themselves ◄ because of their own need or status, or the result of someone else's behavior ≈ often used positively of persons who are sincere and not arrogant in their behavior

H776.def: = the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land

H2244.def: = process by which liquids become solid, ◄ caused by low temperatures during cold weather

H6501.def: = wild donkey of a relatively large size but with relatively small ears; it has a fawn color with a whitish chest and belly; ◄ Persian Wild Ass or Onager, Equus hemonius; ≈ associated with both untameable wildness and sexual desire

H4057.def: = area not very suitable for sedentary life and agriculture because of its lack of water; suitable for grazing domestic animals and only inhabited by nomadic tribes and wild animals

H3318.def: = action by which humans, animals, or objects leave a certain place or position

H6467.def: = an activity performed by a person or deity

H7836.def: = process by which the color of an object turns darker until it is (almost) black

H2964.def: literally: what is torn apart; hence: = slain victim of a carnivorous animal; ≈ associated with a violent death, bloodshed, and frequently used as a metaphor for victims of warfare

H3899.def: = a staple food ◄ made from a dough of water and either wheat or barley then baked; ► together with water considered the very basis of life, often used to refer to food in general

H5288.def: = a young male, ranging from childhood to adulthood; ► often in the service of other people; ≈ typically regarded as healthy and physically strong, but also lacking the experience and wisdom of the {L:older men<SDBH:זָקֵן>}

H1098.def: = mixture ◄ consisting of entire plants, including leaves, stalks, and grain; ► served as food for domestic animals

H7704.def: = a piece of land generally uninhabited by human beings, but where one can find wild animals and plants and trees; consists of grasslands, fields, desert, or forest; can be used for farming, pasturing animals, and hunting; often used in contrast to inhabited land such as cities or encampments.

H3953.def: = causative action by which humans bring together and take in objects from scattered places or sources

H3754.def: = field where {L:grapes<SDBH:עֲנָב>} are cultivated, growing on {L:vines<SDBH:גֶּפֶן>}; typically surrounded by a stone wall, and equipped with a {L:watchtower<SDBH:מִגְדָּל>} and a {L:wine press<SDBH:יֶקֶב>}

H7563.def: = state in which a person's behavior is inconsistent with the requirements of the law, either in a specific matter that is under dispute or as one's general mode of behavior

H1097.def: = particle marking a proposition as not true

H3830.def: = generic designation for any article of clothing

H6174.def: = state in which humans are either without clothes or insufficiently dressed; ≈ often associated with poverty or shame

H369.def: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non-existant

H3682.def: literally: covering; hence: = something that is a visible proof of someone else's innocence in a certain matter

H7135.def: = referring to a state of low temperature

H2022.def: = a relatively high elevation of the earth’s surface; generally higher than a {L:hill<SDBH:גִּבְעָה>}

H2230.def: = process by which copious amounts of water flow from the skies, often accompanied by strong winds and having a destructive effect

H2263.def: = action by which humans put their arms around someone else ► as a greeting, a sign of affection, or during love-making

H6697.def: = hard stony material ◄ that forms the crust of the earth, sometimes exposed on the surface, sometimes hidding under the soil; ≈ associated with hardness, permanence, and security

H1097.def: = particle marking a proposition as not true

H4268.def: = location where one goes to find protection or safety; ◄ because of difficult circumstances

H3490.def: = person whose father has passed away and therefore unable to care for himself; ≈ regarded as one of the weaker members of the society and should therefore receive special care, together with the aliens, the widows, and other people who are poor

H1497.def: = action by which humans take property unlawfully from a person or place, usually by force or threat of force

H6041.def: = a class of people who are suffering, often because of poverty but also because of an oppressive external situation; ≈ associated with humility

H1097.def: = particle marking a proposition as not true

H3830.def: = generic designation for any article of clothing

H1980.def: = process by which liquids or other inanimate objects move from one place to another

H6174.def: = state in which humans are either without clothes or insufficiently dressed; ≈ often associated with poverty or shame

H5375.def: = process by which an object increases in height

H6016.def: = bundle of harvested ears of grain

H7457.def: = condition of not having food to eat, often leading to weakness

H6671.def: = action by which humans press olives ► in order to produce olive oil

H996.def: = the area separating two or mores locations

H1869.def: = action by which humans or animals move forward by lifting and setting down each foot in turn

H3342.def: = large container; ◄ normally hewn out of stone and part of a winepress; ► where the grape juice is collected

H6770.def: = state in which someone senses a feeling of needing or wanting to drink, ► which eventually leads to weakness or even death; ≈ also used in a figurative sense to denote a longing or desire

H5892.def: = relatively large and permanent population center, usually surrounded by a wall and surrounded by a number of dependent {L:villages<SDBH:חָצֵר>}, {L:settlements<SDBH:בַּת>}, and {L:pasturelands<SDBH:מִגְרָשׁ>}; ≈ associated with strength and security

H4962.def: = human beings, regardless of sex and age

H5008.def: = action by which humans make a deep inarticulate sound ◄ caused by pain, grief, or severe suffering

H5315.def: = the part of the body connecting the head to the rest of the body and containing the passageways for blood, air, and food; ≈ associated with breathing, appetite, and life and often used metonymically to refer to the entire body and the personality inhabiting it

H2491.def: = state in which humans or animal are fatally wounded with a sharp object

H7768.def: = action by which humans and animals raise their voice ◄ in times of hardship ► hoping to receive help from God or someone else

H433.def: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

H7760.def: = action by which individuals or groups of humans place themselves in a certain position or configuration

H8604.def: = state when a certain activity does not appear to be in accordance with good sense

24.gl: to place (responsibility on someone) > to lay upon

H4775.def: = action by which humans reject the authority of a ruler or deity to which they had formerly been subjected

H216.def: = light as a physical phenomenon, mainly observed during daytime, and the opposite of darkness; ◄ one of God's most important attributes; first created by God and since produced by sun, moon, and stars, but also by fire; ► enables people and animals to see; ≈ associated with life, goodness, happiness, prosperity, security, favor, and wisdom, loved by the righteous, and hated by the wicked

H5234.def: = process by which humans understand the identity or nature of (other) humans, objects or events

H1870.def: = an open space connecting different places, ► used for travelling and transportation; ≈ often extended to denote our life as a journey from birth to death, and the totality of our activities during our lives

H3427.def: = action by which humans assume a sitting position in a certain location and remain in that position for some time; ≈ sometimes associated with a certain status, role, or common activity

H216.def: = light as a physical phenomenon, mainly observed during daytime, and the opposite of darkness; ◄ one of God's most important attributes; first created by God and since produced by sun, moon, and stars, but also by fire; ► enables people and animals to see; ≈ associated with life, goodness, happiness, prosperity, security, favor, and wisdom, loved by the righteous, and hated by the wicked

H7523.def: = causative action by which humans take the life of other humans, whether or not intentionally

H6991.def: = causative action by which humans or deities cause people to die

H6041.def: = a class of people who are suffering, often because of poverty but also because of an oppressive external situation; ≈ associated with humility

H34.def: = person who does not have the means to provide for himself/herself, economically or otherwise, and therefore depends on help from other people and God

H3915.def: = the time of day that is characterized by darkness; ≈ associated with sleep, fear, evil, and hardship

H1590.def: = human who secretly takes possession of objects belonging to someone else, and sometimes even other humans, without permission or legal right and usually without intending to return it

H5003.def: = action by which married humans have voluntary sexual intercourse with other humans who are not their spouse; ≈ often used as a metaphor for treachery or idolatry

H8104.def: = action by which humans or deities carefully observe an object or event for a longer period of time

H5399.def: = the time of day before the sun comes up and after the sun goes down

H559.def: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

H7789.def: = action by which humans move from one place to another

H7760.def: = action by which individuals or groups of humans place themselves in a certain position or configuration

H2822.def: = state in which there is no light, ◄ caused by the fact that the light of sun, moon, and stars cannot reach the location that is in focus, ► resulting in a state in which no one can readily see, and colors and shapes can no longer be distinguished; loved by the wicked only; ≈ associated with hardship, ignorance, death, and oblivion

H2864.def: = causative action by which humans make a hole in the ground or a wall, usually with the help of a digging tool; ► in order to be able to gain access to the location behind it

H1004.def: = construction surrounded by walls and covered with a roof; ◄ normally made of stones, wood, or clay; ► to be used as living quarters, for storage, as a prison, as a sanctuary, etc.; sometimes used to denote a smaller part of a large construction

H2856.def: = to put a seal on a written document; ► in order to confirm that the document is authentic and to keep unauthorized readers from having access to it; ≈ associated with both authenticity and secrecy

H3045.def: = process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind

H216.def: = light as a physical phenomenon, mainly observed during daytime, and the opposite of darkness; ◄ one of God's most important attributes; first created by God and since produced by sun, moon, and stars, but also by fire; ► enables people and animals to see; ≈ associated with life, goodness, happiness, prosperity, security, favor, and wisdom, loved by the righteous, and hated by the wicked

H6757.def: literally: shadow of death, only found in poetry; hence: = state in which there is a total absence of light ► resulting in a state in which no one can readily see, and colors and shapes can no longer to distinguished; loved by the wicked only; ≈ associated with hardship, ignorance, fear, death, and oblivion

H1242.def: = first half of the day, ranging from daybreak until noon; ≈ used figuratively to denote relief after a time of suffering, and associated with good as opposed to evil

H5234.def: = process by which humans understand the identity or nature of (other) humans, objects or events

H1091.def: = something that instills an intense and overpowering fear in someone else; ≈ often associated with death and darkness

H7031.def: = state in which humans, animals, and things have the ability to move or act with speed ◄ due to lack of weight, agility, strength, training, or energy

H4325.def: = water as the indispensible liquid on which the existence of all life depends, used for drinking, preparing food, washing, irrigating, etc.; found under the earth, on the earth, and above the earth; sometimes used as a euphemism to denote certain body liquids; ≈ associated with abundance and refreshment, but also with instability, and danger, etc.

H2513.def: = object that is owned by someone; ◄ usually with the underlying assumption that it has been shared out to that person (or his ancestors) in the past

H776.def: = the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land

H7043.def: = state in which animals and objects have the ability to move or act with speed ◄ due to lack of weight, agility, strength, training, or energy

H6437.def: = action by which humans or animals turn their body to face a direction different from the one they were facing before

H1870.def: = an open space connecting different places, ► used for travelling and transportation; ≈ often extended to denote our life as a journey from birth to death, and the totality of our activities during our lives

H3754.def: = field where {L:grapes<SDBH:עֲנָב>} are cultivated, growing on {L:vines<SDBH:גֶּפֶן>}; typically surrounded by a stone wall, and equipped with a {L:watchtower<SDBH:מִגְדָּל>} and a {L:wine press<SDBH:יֶקֶב>}

H6723.def: = state in which there is a lack of water or rainfall, ► resulting in lack of vegetation and other desert-like conditions

H1571.def: marker pointing to information that needs to be considered in addition to previous information (either explicit or implied)

H2527.def: = state in which an inanimate object has a relatively high temperature

H1497.def: = action by which humans take property unlawfully from a person or place, usually by force or threat of force

H4325.def: = water as the indispensible liquid on which the existence of all life depends, used for drinking, preparing food, washing, irrigating, etc.; found under the earth, on the earth, and above the earth; sometimes used as a euphemism to denote certain body liquids; ≈ associated with abundance and refreshment, but also with instability, and danger, etc.

H7950.def: = frozen crystallized water vapor in the form of very white flakes which fall as precipitation from the sky and cover the ground during freezing cold weather; as soon as the temperature rises above freezing, it melts and becomes water; ≈ associated with cold, whiteness, or purity

H7585.def: = abode of the dead, a place of darkness and silence, located deep in the earth and inaccessible, where there is neither compassion nor wisdom; ≈ regarded as a place that is never satisfied; often personified; going there before one's time is considered a punishment

H7358.def: = part of the lower body of women and mammals where offspring are conceived and in which they grow until their birth; ≈ sometimes extended to refer to a woman, the time of birth, the place where something is produced, and the innermost part of an area

H7415.def: = small, soft, legless, tube-shaped creatures that have no bones or shells; they typically feed on overripe fruit, rotting meat, and similar things; most are larvae that hatch from the eggs laid by flies or some beetles; associated with uncleanness, mortality, decay, and death

H4985.def: = state in which food tastes well

H6086.def: = any kind of tall, woody plant that grows from a single trunk and with several lateral branches that often bear leaves and fruit

H7462.def: = action by which animals are feeding on grass and other edible materials in the field, ≈ often extended to denote the way a king cares for his subjects or the way God cares for his people

H6135.def: = state in which humans or animals, whether male or female, are unable to procreate

H3190.def: = causative action by which humans cause objects to be in a better state of maintenance than before

H490.def: = woman whose husband has died and therefore has difficulty caring for herself; ≈ regarded as one of the weaker members of the society and should therefore receive special care, together with the aliens, the fatherless, and other people who are poor

H3581.def: = state in which humans, animals or deities have the ability to perform actions, or to prevail in, or endure situations that require the exertion or mustering of effort or force

H4900.def: = state in which humans are of more than average height{N:001}

H47.def: = male bovine; ≈ symbol of deities and associated with power and strength, but also with aggression and therefore often used to denote people who behave as such

H539.def: = state in which an inanimate object is firmly positioned in its place, so that it will not move

H983.def: = state in which humans live with confidence and without fear; ≈ often regarded as carelessness, especially when there is no mention of trust in YHWH

H8172.def: = state in which humans rest part of their body, such as their back or their arms, on an object that provides support, such as a tree or stick

H1870.def: = an open space connecting different places, ► used for travelling and transportation; ≈ often extended to denote our life as a journey from birth to death, and the totality of our activities during our lives

H4592.def: = small quantity of objects or substance

H369.def: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non-existant

H4355.def: = process by which a flat object bulges downwards through weight, pressure, or lack of strength

H7092.def: literally: to close part of one's body; hence: = to stop engaging part of one's body ► in order to stop performing a certain action

H7218.def: = upper part of the human body, or the front or upper part of the body of an animal, typically separated from the rest of the body by a neck, and containing the brain, mouth, and sense organs; ≈ associated with the entire person, that person's life, and that person's responsibilities

H518.def: = marker indicating that the event in focus has to be true before another event can take place

H645.def: = particle linking two propositions, by which Y represents the purpose or result  of X

H4310.def: = a reference to an unknown person or deity; normally used with the purpose of identifying that person or deity; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that person or deity cannot be identified

H3576.def: = action by which a human or deity says or reveals something that is not true

H7760.def: = action by which individuals or groups of humans place themselves in a certain position or configuration

H4405.def: used in poetry only; = a single distinct meaningful element of speech or writing, used to form sentences with others

12.gl: to prove someone to be a liar
